newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: SOCCER-LACKLUSTRE AJAX DRAW AT HOME IN DUTCH LEAGUE.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-LACKLUSTRE AJAX DRAW AT HOME IN DUTCH LEAGUE.

text.p: Defending champions Ajax Amsterdam were held to a 1-1 draw at home to De Graafschap Doetinchem in the Dutch first division on Sunday and trail leaders Feyenoord Rotterdam by eight points.

Feyenoord scored a 1-0 away win over Sparta Rotterdam in a local derby on Saturday to extend their lead to three points over PSV Eindhoven, who could manage no more than a goalless draw at home to Vitesse Arnhem the same day.
Ajax, who had never previously dropped home points to De Graafschap, have 11 points from seven matches and are seventh in the table.
Strikers Jari Litmanen and Nordin Wooter were the only Ajax players who showed any form ahead of Wednesday's European Cup Champions' League match against Grasshopper Zurich.
Litmanen opened the scoring in the 57th minute with a close-range shot after De Graafschap had failed to convert three big chances in the opening minutes of the second half.
After the Finn's goal the Graafschap attack, led by former Grasshopper players Ali Ibrahim and Eric Viscaal, failed to take full advantage of a vulnerable Ajax defence.
But in the 87th minute defender Erik Redeker scored a deserved equaliser when he headed past Ajax's international goalkeeper Edwin van der Sar after a corner.

At the bottom of the table Groningen still await their first win of the season. On Sunday they lost 2-1 at home to RKC Waalwijk, whose midfielder Alfred Schreuder scored the winner with a lob from just inside his own half.
